channel.title: BBC News - Science & Environment
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Boris Johnson: Humanity is reaching a turning point on climate change
item.description: Boris Johnson says world leaders must take responsibility for climate destruction at an upcoming summit.

item.title: Covid: Immune therapy from llamas shows promise
item.description: An immune therapy derived from llama blood shows "exciting potential" in early coronavirus trials.

item.title: Air pollution: Even worse than we thought - WHO
item.description: The WHO is slashing recommended maximum limits of key pollutants as evidence of danger mounts.

item.title: President Biden urges unity in first UN speech amid tensions with allies
item.description: Joe Biden called for cooperation in his first speech as US president to the UN General Assembly.

item.title: China pledges to stop building new coal energy plants abroad
item.description: The announcement is the country's latest climate pledge and a major step forward to address emissions.

item.title: PPE hospital masks find new life fighting plastic waste
item.description: All schools and colleges in Cornwall will be given litter pickers made from old hospital masks.

item.title: Gas price crisis: Food firms face huge price rise for carbon dioxide
item.description: The US supplier of CO2, which will receive millions in UK taxpayer support to reopen, will hike prices.

item.title: Climate reporting reaches melting point
item.description: A trip to a melting glacier will shape how the BBC's new climate editor reports on climate change.

item.title: M25 protests: Protesters 'may cause serious injury or death'
item.description: Insulate Britain protesters blocked traffic on both carriageways of the motorway in Surrey.

item.title: Nasa selects landing site for Moon rover mission
item.description: The space agency will send a rover to look for water-ice near a crater at the Moon's South Pole.

item.title: Why is there a CO2 shortage and how will it hit food supplies?
item.description: The government is to pay to reopen a plant that makes commercial carbon dioxide, to stop widespread disruption to food and drink production.

item.title: Rich nations must increase climate support funds, says Boris Johnson
item.description: The UK prime minister says he is "increasingly frustrated" at support offered to poorer countries.

item.title: COP 26: How much is the developing world getting to fight climate change?
item.description: Are rich countries living up to their climate promises to the developing world?

item.title: Life at 50C: Heat hitting home in Australia
item.description: Cities like Sydney are already experiencing extremely hot days because of climate change.

item.title: Climate change: UN warning over nations' climate plans
item.description: Climate plans of more than 100 countries show we're heading in the wrong direction, the UN says.

item.title: Climate change: Should green campaigners put more pressure on China to slash emissions?
item.description: UK activists have protested on the M25, but should they instead be picketing China's embassy?

item.title: Earthshot Prize: Prince William's environment finalists unveiled
item.description: The 15 finalists of Prince William's inaugural Earthshot Prize are tackling the planet's problems.

item.title: Climate change: Biden urges world leaders to cut methane gas emissions
item.description: The president asks leaders to commit to cutting emissions by at least 30% below 2020 levels by 2030.

item.title: Pakistan: How to cool Karachi as temperatures rise
item.description: In Karachi, Pakistan, one entrepreneur is on a mission to plant urban forests to cope with rising temperatures.

item.title: SpaceX: Inspiration4 amateur astronauts return to Earth after three days
item.description: The four amateur astronauts landed safely in the Atlantic Ocean after three days orbiting Earth.

item.title: Inspiration4: All-amateur space crew enjoy views of Earth
item.description: The first pictures have been released showing the Inspiration4 crew looking down on the planet.

item.title: Astronauts return to Earth after China's longest space mission
item.description: The three astronauts spent 90 days at China's space station, some 380km above Earth.

item.title: International Space Station: Smoke triggers alert on board
item.description: The alarm went off as the space station's batteries were being charged, Russia's space agency says.

item.title: Antarctic: Exhibition recalls Ernest Shackleton's final quest
item.description: It's 100 years since the great Antarctic explorer set out on his last voyage to the White Continent.

item.title: Ocean Photographer of the Year 2021
item.description: An image of a green sea turtle surrounded by glass fish wins photo award.

item.title: Climate change: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
item.description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

item.title: Mangrove forests: Photography winners show beauty of ecosystems
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Tireless inventor ahead of his time
item.description: The prolific innovator invented the pocket calculator and the ill-fated Sinclair C5 electric car.

item.title: Asteroid that wiped out dinosaurs shaped fortunes of snakes
item.description: Snakes owe their success in part to the asteroid impact that killed off the dinosaurs 66 million years ago.

item.title: Megapod of feeding humpback whales in Australia 'so special'
item.description: More than 100 humpback whales have been filmed feeding off Australia's New South Wales coast.
